docs.lead_paragraph: A novel method known as whole genome sequencing focuses on genes that drive a cancer, not the tissues or organ where it originates.

headline.seo: In Gene Sequencing Treatment for Leukemia, Glimpses of the Future
headline.main: In Treatment for Leukemia, Glimpses of the Future
headline.print_headline: In Leukemia Treatment, Glimpses of the Future

docs.abstract: Emerging cancer diagnostic process known as whole genome sequencing attempts to discover the genes that drive a specific instance of cancer, rather than focusing on the tissue or organ where the cancer originates; procedure remains expensive but experts believe that it will eventually become a standard part of cancer treatment (Series: Genetic Gamble).
docs.snippet: A novel method known as whole genome sequencing focuses on genes that drive a cancer, not the tissues or organ where it originates.

docs.lead_paragraph: Critics of the health care law, having lost one battle in the Supreme Court, are mounting a challenge to President Obama’s interpretation of another important provision.

headline.seo: Critics of Health Care Law Prepare to Battle Over Insurance Exchange Subsidies
headline.main: Brawling Over Health Care Moves to Rules on Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Next Health Law Battle: Insurance Exchanges

docs.abstract: Critics of the health care law, having lost one battle in the Supreme Court, are mounting a challenge to President Obama’s interpretation of another important provision, under which the federal government will subsidize health insurance for low- and middle-income people; at issue is whether the subsidies will be available in exchanges set up and run by the government in states that fail or refuse to establish their own exchanges..
docs.snippet: Critics of the health care law, having lost one battle in the Supreme Court, are mounting a challenge to President Obama’s interpretation of another important provision.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: When seeking predictions, should we trust the experts or the crowd?
docs.abstract: David Leonhardt Capital Ideas column reflects on the many inaccurate predictions made about the Supreme Court's decision on the health care reform law, such as on the online betting site Intrade; contends that the flawed predictions displayed how ineffective prediction markets can be, but also served as a reminder that even predictions made by experts are frequently wrong.
docs.snippet: When seeking predictions, should we trust the experts or the crowd?

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A friendly approach to a problem, dealing with skeptics, building a better vocabulary and a personal appeal.

headline.seo: A Plan for Making Friends on Facebook
headline.main: You’ve Got a Friend in Me
headline.print_headline: You’ve Got A Friend in Me

docs.abstract: Philip Galanes Social Q's on friending people on Facebook, dealing with skeptics, offensive vocabulary, showing appreciation, and tipping for services covered by health insurance.
docs.snippet: A friendly approach to a problem, dealing with skeptics, building a better vocabulary and a personal appeal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most travelers know to get immunizations ahead of time and to pack their prescriptions in carry-ons. A new Web site called Emergencylink.com takes health preparedness one step further by allowing travelers to upload their medical records and designate a contact in their social network who has access to their information in case of emergency. Unlike other paid-plan medical programs, the free service does not arrange treatment or evacuation. Instead, it operates a 24-hour line that emergency medical technicians can call to treat a traveler who is mentally incapacitated. (A traveler's member ID card includes the number.) Emergencylink.com then provides information, including insurance, medications and allergies, and then calls the emergency contact, who can be patched through to E.M.T.'s and reach out to a traveler's family members and hospital if a stay is required.

headline.main: New Service Shares Your Medical Information

docs.abstract: In Transit blog on Emergencylink.com, Web site that allows travelers to upload their medical records and designate emergency contacts for access to the information in case of an emergency. Photo (M)
